rows.story_text: My heart feels a lot of things.

story_text.eng: My heart feels a lot of things.

annotation_1.eng: Think of different feelings you have. How many can you think of?

annotation_2.eng: Tell a story about a time when you felt one of those feelings.

annotation_3.eng: Do your feelings fit into a few groups? For example, are they all happy or sad feelings?

rows.annotation_1: Think of different feelings you have. How many can you think of?
rows.annotation_2: Tell a story about a time when you felt one of those feelings.
rows.annotation_3: Do your feelings fit into a few groups? For example, are they all happy or sad feelings?

rows.story_text: I feel happy when my granny tells us stories in the evening.

story_text.eng: I feel happy when my granny tells us stories in the evening.

annotation_1.eng: Do you know a special person who loves to tell you stories? Does it make you feel good to hear that person tell stories?

annotation_2.eng: Count together how many children are listening to granny's story. If you add granny to that count, it will be one more -- how many would that make?

annotation_3.eng: Do these children look happy? How can you tell?

rows.annotation_1: Do you know a special person who loves to tell you stories? Does it make you feel good to hear that person tell stories?
rows.annotation_2: Count together how many children are listening to granny's story. If you add granny to that count, it will be one more -- how many would that make?
rows.annotation_3: Do these children look happy? How can you tell?

rows.story_text: I feel silly when I play with my friend.

story_text.eng: I feel silly when I play with my friend.

annotation_1.eng: What things do you do when you are being silly?

annotation_2.eng: Count together the hands, feet, eyes, noses, fingers, toes, or anything else you see.

annotation_3.eng: Which group of things has the biggest number and which one has the smallest?

rows.annotation_1: What things do you do when you are being silly?
rows.annotation_2: Count together the hands, feet, eyes, noses, fingers, toes, or anything else you see.
rows.annotation_3: Which group of things has the biggest number and which one has the smallest?

rows.story_text: I feel bad when my dad says he does not have money.

story_text.eng: I feel bad when my dad says he does not have money.

annotation_1.eng: What sorts of things make you sad?

annotation_2.eng: Point to and name the colors of their different pieces of clothing.

annotation_3.eng: Count the number of buttons on her dress.

rows.annotation_1: What sorts of things make you sad?
rows.annotation_2: Point to and name the colors of their different pieces of clothing.
rows.annotation_3: Count the number of buttons on her dress.

rows.story_text: I feel loved when my mom gives me a hug.

story_text.eng: I feel loved when my mom gives me a hug.

annotation_1.eng: What are some special moments that make you feel loved?

annotation_2.eng: What do you do to let others know you feel love for them?

annotation_3.eng: The mother's clothing has stripes and the girl's has stars. Do you have some clothes with stars or some other shapes on them?

rows.annotation_1: What are some special moments that make you feel loved?
rows.annotation_2: What do you do to let others know you feel love for them?
rows.annotation_3: The mother's clothing has stripes and the girl's has stars. Do you have some clothes with stars or some other shapes on them?
